title: Huge lag spikes without high ping
body:
It's been days now. I randomly get lags that last severa seconds and I don't experience high pings.

This has been costing me games over games and I cna't find a way to fix it.

I run the Troubleshotting analyzer and I have no "packet loss" voice in the analisys results

Edit:
**Solved**
The issue was myrouter not being updated. Thanks every1 for your patience and help.

replies.body:
This is most likely happening due to packet loss. I know you mentioned you used the tool and it didn't mention "packet loss voice" but I'm a little confused by what you mean "voice"? 

Go ahead and run this [**log reader**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743) again using the most recent game that had the lag spikes. Take a screenshot of what it says using something like Gyazo and link it here for us to go over together.

Ok, I took some time and indeed noticed that the logs showed a lot of packet loss (22% average).

I am reading the solutions and will report back about them working or not, thank you.

Edit: Reporting back, I contacted my internet provider and it turns out my modem hadn't update for a long time so I asked them to force it and for now all is working as intended. Thanks a lot for your help.

I don't think it's about fps drops. The game goes fluently but I I keep walking with nothing happening, then I see my skill animation go (always fluently), gold gains on killing minions, etc. 

It's just delayed, I have no fluidity issues.
That's connectivity you're experiencing then, have you gone through the steps in the first article I linked?
Yes no packet loss, but I don't know what to look for then. And ocne again, i'm not experiencing ping increasing.

I know you stated no packet loss but the other steps may improve the issue. If you've gone through all of them already, 

1. Power cycle your modem / router (turn off and on again after ~1 minute).
2. Contact your ISP if you issue hasn't improved.

Will try and report back tomorrow (it's late now here).

Thanks for the help.

Edit: It was a packet loss issue, I will be try to fix it tomorrow (EUW).
I solved it, try to run the steps provided in this thread.
